sols_html:
Proceed by contradiction. Suppose that there exist integers x and y such that \(\displaystyle px = 8n+3\) and \(\displaystyle py = 5n+2\). Multiplying the first by 5 and the second equation by 8 gives

\[\begin{aligned} 5px &= 40n + 15 \\ 8py &= 40n + 16 \end{aligned}\]

subtracting the two equations gives \(\displaystyle p(8y-5x) = 1\) and as p is prime, it divides the left hand side but not the right hand side which is a contradiction. Hence no such prime number can exist.
